thread.title: DC Download: Cove's Co-Working Future and Virginia Tech's Innovation Ambition
thread.title_full: DC Download: Cove's Co-Working Future and Virginia Tech's Innovation Ambition

author: Eric Hal Schwartz
title: DC Download: Cove's Co-Working Future and Virginia Tech's Innovation Ambition
text: Image via Cove How Virginia Tech will beat MIT and Stanford at entrepreneurship Virginia Tech thinks it can become a hub of innovation and entrepreneurship to rival any school in the country. I talked to the head of the Apex Systems Center for Innovation and Entrepreneurship to find how a newly opened lab fits into the school's plans to entice the best and brightest away from places like MIT and Stanford in favor of coming to Blacksburg. Read the full story here . Is Cove the future of co-working? Cove is the co-working space for when you need a place to work that isn't a coffee shop but doesn't require a major commitment. Chris Bing talked to the CEO about the company's rapidly expanding footprint in the area and how it fits into the city's co-working ecosystem. Read his full story here . How to skip the Metro at 20 mph D.C.-based electric bike startup maker Riide just made it a lot easier to hop on their 20 mph Metro alternative. I talked to one of the founders to find out how the new RiidePass program skips over the high up-front cost with a lease-to-own option. Check out the full story here . Virginia's CIT gets a new boss Virginia Governor Terry McAuliffe announced that former Hilltop Companies COO Ed Albrigo will CEO of the Herndon-based Center for Innovative Technology. Current CIT President/CEO Peter Jobse announced in March that he would leave to rejoin the private sector. Chris Bing explains why this move is so important in his coverage here . All the tech news in D.C. you need to know.
